security_audit.summary: This skill contains only markdown documentation files with hook configuration templates. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or file system access. Pure reference content for Claude Code hook configuration.

content.user_title: Configure Claude Code hooks for automation
content.value_statement: Claude Code hooks enable automated validation, logging, and notifications during AI tool execution. This skill provides templates and best practices for configuring PreToolUse, PostToolUse, Notification, and Stop hooks.
actual_capabilities: Create PreToolUse validation hooks to validate tool inputs before execution
Set up PostToolUse logging hooks to record tool outputs and file changes
Configure notification hooks for custom alerts and integrations
Implement Stop hooks for cleanup tasks and final reports
Document hook patterns and matcher configurations
Provide environment variable references for hook scripts
limitations: This skill provides reference documentation only, not executable hook code
Users must manually configure hooks in ~/.claude/settings.json
Hook commands must be written and tested by the user
No runtime hook execution or management capabilities

best_practices: Keep hooks fast (under 1 second) to avoid blocking Claude Code execution
Use specific matcher patterns instead of wildcards to target only needed tools
Handle errors gracefully with proper shell error handling to prevent cascade failures
anti_patterns: Using verbose logging in hooks that adds excessive output to the conversation context
Creating hooks that block indefinitely without timeout handling
Configuring hooks for all tools (*) when only specific tools need automation

faq.question: Which Claude versions support hooks?
faq.answer: Hooks require Claude Code version 0.9.0 or later. Check your installation with 'claude --version'.

faq.question: What is the maximum hook execution time?
faq.answer: Hooks should complete in under 1 second. Long-running hooks will block Claude Code tool execution.

faq.question: How do hooks integrate with MCP tools?
faq.answer: Use matcher pattern 'mcp__*' to target all MCP tools, or specific MCP tool names for individual tools.

faq.question: Are hooks secure?
faq.answer: Hooks run as your user with your permissions. Only install hooks from trusted sources and review commands before use.

faq.question: Why is my hook not triggering?
faq.answer: Check that your settings.json has correct JSON syntax, the event name matches (PreToolUse, PostToolUse), and matcher patterns are valid.

faq.question: How do hooks differ from custom instructions?
faq.answer: Hooks execute shell commands automatically on events, while custom instructions affect Claude's behavior through prompt context.
